How does DDM coating affect the electroo: The DDM coating reduces the EOF by covering the charges on the PDMS surface. Measurements using current monitoring method show that the electroosmotic mobility of 20 mM Hepes buffer (pH 8) in a PDMS channel is reduced from 5.6 × 10−4 cm2 V−1 s−1 to 2.8 × 10−4 cm2 V−1 s−1 (dynamic coating) or 4.0 × 10−4 cm2 V−1 s−1 (permanent coating).
